abstract: United Nations ignored warnings that peacekeeping force from Democratic Republic of Congo was unfit for duty in Central African Republic, where troops are accused of rampant sexual abuse; episode underscores how necessity of rapid responses combined with lack of reliable soldiers gravely compromises UN's peacekeeping mission.

headline.print_headline: U.N. Officials Warned That Congolese Force Was Linked to Rape
headline.main: U.N. Officials Warned That Congolese Soldiers Were Linked to Rape

keywords.value: War Crimes, Genocide and Crimes Against Humanity
keywords.name: subject

keywords.value: United Nations Department of Peacekeeping Operations
keywords.name: organizations

snippet: Just months after troops from the Democratic Republic of Congo arrived on a peacekeeping mission in the Central African Republic, allegations of sexual abuse began piling up.
lead_paragraph: Just months after troops from the Democratic Republic of Congo arrived on a peacekeeping mission in the Central African Republic, allegations of sexual abuse began piling up.
